insure.translation[0].definitions[0].def: to buy insurance so that you will receive money if something bad happens to you, your family, your possessions etc
insure.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: Have you insured the contents of your home?
It is wise to insure your property against storm damage.
You should insure the painting for at least £100,000.
insure.translation[0].definitions[1].def: to provide insurance for something or someone
insure.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: Many companies won’t insure young drivers.
insure.translation[1].definitions[0].def: to buy insurance to protect yourself, your family, your business etc against something bad happening, for example accidents, damage to property, or injury caused to others
insure.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: Many companies insure executives’ lives with the companies as beneficiaries.
Airlines insure their aircraft for their replacement value.
It is advisable to insure all oriental carpets against theft and damage.
insure.translation[1].definitions[1].def: to provide insurance for something or someone
insure.translation[1].definitions[1].exa: The company insured against earthquakes and accidents at sea.
